title: buff jungle exp back?
body:
Having more farm + less deaths than all my lanes while simultaineously being 1-2 levels below them doesn't feel very good tbh.

By the time you finish the first full clear of the jungle + scuttle you end up level 3.5 while mid and top are level 5... it's pretty dumb

The only scenario where i am not underleveled is when laners screw up and lose a ton of xp due to deaths and roaming.

replies.body: Jg is so punishing that if you get invaded and killed it's kinda over for you. You can't contest the other jg anymore and he takes over everything and the blame starts.
I agree so much...

Yeah lol, everyone just starts red now and does red->krugs->scuttle->gank->your blue. Problem is that if your team doesn't defend your blue and their team does you literally just insta lose the game, theres almost no way you come back from that big of an exp adv.

I mained jungle for practically every season since beta, but not this season. 

I find it too hard to catch up if you fall even slightly behind the enemy jg, nevermind laners. With the loss of the Jungle ward items, stealing enemy mob camps is far too risk free. Combine that with respawn rates, low exp, etc etc, you're screwed. 

Meanwhile the lanes are crying, not realizing how losing one camp can affect you so much.
Yeah, a jungler that has the lead on you and invades you is pretty much game over unless your team helps you counter his invades...which we know doesn't happen alot.

I've played at a range of different ELO/MMRs in my time, and the reason everyones opinion is legitimate is that honestly, the way the game plays is vastly different at different levels of play, so the game plays out a lot differently. For this reason, someone at your level or 1 higher usually has better advice than someone way higher.

It's good to take tips from much better players, but if you try to apply them directly instead of adapt them to how others around you play, you'll have a bad day.

Think of it this way, 10 people in a bronze game, all are bad. If you see someone doing really stupid crap, you should instantly realize 2 things. 

1. If they're doing something this bad, you're doing something equally bad somewhere else.
2. You're at the same rank, so again, for everything that's blatantly wrong with them there is equally with you. BUT that means they're holding the same rank for reasons you don't understand. So the best way to move up is simply find a like minded person, and start working on eachothers play styles, close your weaknesses that are not shared, move up, repeat.

Honestly, all these "pay for training" things are crap. If you really want to learn you eat humble pie to the face and start trading information at your own level and take it 1 step at a time, not pay some nerd $1000 for a "quick path to challenger"

In addition to selecting a path, there are several other things to take in account when clearing the jungle:

1. Ability/resource management. Do you want to waste mana to kill the camp a little faster but run out of mana soon after? Do you need that long cd spell to clear the camp or save it for the gank?

2. Pulling the camp. Between autoattacks, you should cycle back and forth from the camp to minimize the damage you take from monsters and wait off cooldowns. 

3. Effective clear. You can put the pull indicator to its limit and finish the camp with a spell while already walking away. This saves time. Also with some champions you can clear two camps such as blue and gromp at the same time.

4. Smite usage. Save it to contest an early scuttler or need it elsewhere? Use chilling smite during a gank and risk losing a dragon later?

5. General knowledge. Rift Scuttler loses its resists when hit by hard CC. Hit Herald in the eye from behind for more damage. Pull dragon out of the pit so it's harder to steal. Don't stay behind Baron or you die faster. 

The list could go on. As you see, killing camps isn't as simple as just "killing camps". With all the other decisionmaking related to jungling it requires a lot of brainwork to jungle correctly. And I doubt silvers know/execute every action I mentioned.

So i'm not silver but my highest rank is Gold I, just want to say I execute everything you mentioned perfectly every game. Doesn't stop me from ending up behind every match to my mid lane or top lane, who level way more quicker. In my opinion Jungle is the worst role in this game right now, if a enemy top laner or mid laner gets ahead its insanely punishing and they can end up 1-2 levels higher than you after your jungle clear. This makes it hard to gank because it makes a possible 2v2 impossible. I really think that jungle exp needs to be on par or just a bit behind top/mid lane. Bottom lane will always be the most behind in levels because youre trying to have your ADC farm efficiently and become a Carry late game, while having a champion that can protect him from other lane. But when I finish a Jungle clear and get to level 5 on 2nd clear, and the enemy top laner with one kill is level 7, there's not much I can do in a 2v2 situation. 
Honestly its just dumb how Jungle gets punished so hard by your own laners doing bad. Ive played Jungle for 3 years and I couldve gotten Platinum but ive never committed, but this season is awful. I feel like nothing I do matters. I had a game as J4 where I got 6 assists between all my lanes within the first 10 minutes and we still lost. Because Jungle just doesnt hold any weight except for contesting Baron/herald/Dragon and helping assist with vision/ganks.

The argument is not that jungling cannot be impactful y'all, the argument is that jungling takes too much skill/a lot of luck (praying people push their waves so they're easy ganks, pray your teammates know how to properly follow up with your gank attempts) to be impactful. 

When I jungle, the fact I'm behind is constantly looping in my head. I do my first clearing path red side, then go to top to gank but fail - the guy flashes, or just isn't pushed up, etc. My first thought is "great, now I'm even more behind", and it just continues on. If you're not constantly seeing action, you're behind. If you aren't killing people left and right, you're behind. At best you're barely even with bot lane, you won't catch up to mid or top. It's ridiculous how unrewarding the jungle is to play.

And say I'm low level or whatever, but that's the point. No role should need godly amounts of experience, skill, and even luck to be able to impact the game at all.
